item.title: 3 soiled mattresses, sofa and household rubbish fytipped on the pavement, 4th February
item.description:
The footpath is entirely blocked by the mattressesabd sofa. The mattresses have been here over a week. The sofa appeared in the last few days. This is a hot-spot of flytipping. It's gross and you have walk in the road to get past. This is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Stockwell, Greater London

item.title: Large commercial fridge dumped on pavement, 4th February
item.description:
This large commercial fridge was flytipped around 17/18 January 2026. It has been reported to Lambeth council multiple times on 18 January 2026. It is blocking an already narrow footpath. It is on the north side of Burnley Road opposite the cycle hangar.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14-25, Burnley Road, Stockwell, Greater London

item.title: Huge hole around manhole on stretch of poor quality road, 4th February
item.description:
Heading from Crayford to Bexley adjacent to Hall Palce playing fields the surface is poor. There is one inspection cover where there are huge holes around it with metal jutting up completely blocking the line metre or so from the kerb where cyclist has to ride. There is no choice but to go over it and this risks death or serious injury for the cyclist along this high speed cut through used by many vehicles avoiding delays on the A2. The holes around the inspection cover ar so large that it will take a cyclist off risking death or serious injury. Because of the dangerous nature of this a strictly enforced 20 mile per hour speed limit is needed along this road in both directions to protect vulnerable road users until the local authority get to grips with the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bumps and road surface, 4th February
item.description:
The speed bumps and road surface on the road and up along heron hill is in a poor condition, along with faded road markings making it hard to see the speed bumps in wet dark nights. As its a hill, the water when it rains heavily can cause the surface area of the road to be slippery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Augustines Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
